metadata.name: Short Description
metadata.value: The Senior Accountant is an autonomous role with the opportunity to impact our teams through your attention to detail and creative execution. Using your knowledge of payroll, you’ll take ownership and leadership of our payroll process. You’ll leverage accounting best practices to maintain our position as one of the top digital product agencies in the nation.

title: Senior Accountant, Payroll
content:
Who We Are
WillowTree, a TELUS International Company, partners with the world’s leading brands to help them tackle their thorniest challenges - launching new digital products, delivering personalized marketing at scale, or harnessing the power of data and AI to transform their business. These mission-critical initiatives aren’t solved by a single discipline. Great digital is a team game - it requires seamlessly combining strategy, engineering, design, data science, marketing, and more. Other firms have bolted on these capabilities - as digital natives, we’ve built them into our teams from Day 1. The result? Top and bottom lines that grow alongside our client’s capabilities. Check out how we have impacted our clients' digital portfolios over the years.
In January 2023, WillowTree was acquired by TELUS International (Symbol: TIXT).  The combined company brings an unparalleled ability to deliver seamless, trusted, digitally-enabled experiences across any channel a customer might choose - mobile apps, websites, voice skills, chatbots, email, service agents, or associates.
Location & Flexibility
When team members told us they needed more flexibility and autonomy around where and how they worked, we created two options to accommodate two different work styles. One non-negotiable principle along the way? We had to retain our deep culture of collaboration, both among ourselves and with our clients. Introducing Work From Near (Hybrid) and Work From Anywhere (Remote) at WillowTree. Learn more here.
This role will have the option to be in a Work From Near (Hybrid) capacity based out of one of our offices OR in a Work From Anywhere (Remote) capacity with travel to clients and WillowTree offices expected.
The Opportunity
As one of the key members of our Payroll Accounting team, you will have an opportunity for your ideas, efficiencies, and optimization to take root in our vision for a global payroll approach at WillowTree. Working alongside committed and driven HR and Accounting colleagues, you will work to ensure that the most valuable element of our business, our people, needs are met in the realm of payroll. Our business has grown from exclusively a US-based to a multi-national organization, resulting in an exciting and complex payroll scenario.   
Responsibilities

Manage multi-state and global payroll census and process ad-hoc deductions or earnings
Maintain the payroll system, including work locations, setup of earnings/deductions, and other system maintenance
Prepare journal entries to allocate payroll/benefits to appropriate cost centers
Lead HSA administration
Prepare reports and journal entries during the financial close as well as other ad-hoc needs
Reconcile payroll-related accounts
Identify and resolve discrepancies with payroll
Collaborate with both internal and client partners on financial matters

Qualifications

3+ years of global accounting experience
Experience in posting payroll journal entries and/or payroll reconciliations
Expertise with Payroll, specifically payroll taxes, pre-tax and post-tax deductions, earnings, and fringe benefits
Proficiency with financial management software and Microsoft Excel
Displays high levels of partnership in team environments 
Proven track record of collaborating with clients and/or cross-disciplinary stakeholders effectively
Basic understanding of HR laws (although we have a separate HR team)

Bonus Points

Expertise with UKG Pro and/or Workday 
Degree in Accounting/Finance or CPA
Benefits Administration experience a plus

Why WillowTree?
We offer a place to be yourself.
Our differences, both visible and invisible, benefit our teams, our communities, and the products we craft. That’s why WillowTree strives to build a team with diverse backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. You’ll work hard here; however, we’ll balance that with a culture that supports your growth and cares about your well-being. We’re committed to creating an environment of inclusion — a place where every Tree can thrive.
We want you to reach your fullest potential and part of your professional development at WillowTree will include dedicated time to innovate on passion projects and an annual stipend to fund your professional pursuits.
WillowTree celebrates our differences and provides equal employment opportunities to all team members and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.
